title: Sting A Winter's Night...Live from Durham Cathedral 720p
description:
Description : Concert holder 16 awards "Grammy" - Sting at Durham Cathedral of Christ and the Blessed Virgin Mary (Durham Cathedral). Concert in the cathedral is a fine example of Romanesque architecture of the eleventh century, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is dedicated to the beloved singer season. "It is the winter of our ancestors traditionally gathered around the fireplace in the cold evenings, sang old and new songs composed," - said Sting. Old English folk songs and ballads are combined with works of classical composers and singers own compositions. " first song takes us to the snowy medieval England, mysterious, cold, but incredibly attractive. In Soul Cake, reminiscent of our carols and sees a peasant, strode briskly along the creaking snow to visit a neighbor, somewhere in the vicinity of Norfolk. We see the farmer and other songs disc filled with a special light evening snow crackling logs in the fire small home fireplace. Generally, all the songs here are endowed with a very lively imaginative next, due to the special roughness voice soloist and various authentic instruments. Here and cocky Irish violin, tuba and soft, and the unusual tone in drawing and percussion, Chris Boti copper and Ibrahim Maalouf, and instantly creates a unique folk flavor Northumbrian bagpipes. Just can not describe it to be heard. perepevki own folklore and songs Sting The Hounds of Winter, as well as exquisite Lullaby to an Anxious Child - cause a complete delight, can not be said about his flirtation with the classics. Aria Purcell Now Winter Comes Slowly came astilichnoy and pop melodies of Bach harmonization You Only Cross My Mind In Winter puzzling. Perhaps he failed only song from "Winter Road" by Schubert The Hurdy-Gurdy Man. However, fans of the classics are unlikely to listen to this album, and Sting fans will forgive him these small slips.
